titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the City of Brooklyn property tax assessments 1978.158
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:11:58 +0000.

did.unittitle: City of Brooklyn property tax assessments
did.abstract: Nine volumes containing property tax assessments for Wards 1 through 9 in the City of Brooklyn for the year 1841. Each volume number corresponds to the number of the ward in which it was used to record assessments. In each volume, assessments are organized by street name. For each street name, the volumes list the names of property owners on that street, descriptions and values of the properties, and amount taxed. Volume 6, containing property assessments for Ward 6, also includes assessments for the year 1840.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); City of Brooklyn property tax assessments, 1978.158, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1978.
